content: The Military Divisions

And the children of Israel, according to their number, the heads of fathers’  the captains of thousands and hundreds and their officers, served the king in every matter of the  divisions.  came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year, each division  twenty-four thousand.
Over the first division for the first month  Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel, and in his division  twenty-four thousand;
of the children of Perez, and the chief of all the captains of the army for the first month.
Over the division of the second month  Dodai an Ahohite, and of his division Mikloth also  the leader; in his division  twenty-four thousand.
The third captain of the army for the third month  Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada the priest, who was chief; in his division  twenty-four thousand.
This was the Benaiah  mighty  the thirty, and was over the thirty; in his division  Ammizabad his son.
The fourth  for the fourth month  Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him; in his division  twenty-four thousand.
The fifth captain for the fifth month  Shamhuth the Izrahite; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
The sixth  for the sixth month  Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite; in his division  twenty-four thousand.
The seventh  for the seventh month  Helez the Pelonite, of the children of Ephraim; in his division  twenty-four thousand.
The eighth  for the eighth month  Sibbechai the Hushathite, of the Zarhites; in his division  twenty-four thousand.
The ninth  for the ninth month  Abiezer the Anathothite, of the Benjamites; in his division  twenty-four thousand.
The tenth  for the tenth month  Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zarhites; in his division  twenty-four thousand.
The eleventh  for the eleventh month  Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim; in his division  twenty-four thousand.
The twelfth  for the twelfth month  Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel; in his division  twenty-four thousand.
Leaders of Tribes
Furthermore, over the tribes of Israel: the officer over the Reubenites  Eliezer the son of Zichri; over the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maachah;
the Levites, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel; over the Aaronites, Zadok;
Judah, Elihu,  of David’s brothers;  Issachar, Omri the son of Michael;
Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah;  Naphtali, Jerimoth the son of Azriel;
the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah;  the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah;
the half- of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah;  Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner;
Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These  the leaders of the tribes of Israel.
But David did not take the number of those twenty years old and under, because the  had said He would multiply Israel like the stars of the heavens.
Joab the son of Zeruiah began a census, but he did not finish, for wrath came upon Israel because of this census; nor was the number recorded in the account of the chronicles of King David.
Other State Officials
And Azmaveth the son of Adiel  over the king’s treasuries; and Jehonathan the son of Uzziah was over the storehouses in the field, in the cities, in the villages, and in the fortresses.
Ezri the son of Chelub was over those who did the work of the field for tilling the ground.
And Shimei the Ramathite  over the vineyards, and Zabdi the Shiphmite was over the produce of the vineyards for the supply of wine.
Baal-Hanan the Gederite was over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that  in the lowlands, and Joash  over the store of oil.
And Shitrai the Sharonite  over the herds that fed in Sharon, and Shaphat the son of Adlai was over the herds  in the valleys.
Obil the Ishmaelite  over the camels, Jehdeiah the Meronothite  over the donkeys,
and Jaziz the Hagrite  over the flocks. All these  the officials over King David’s property.
Also Jehonathan, David’s uncle,  a counselor, a wise man, and a scribe; and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni  with the king’s sons.
Ahithophel  the king’s counselor, and Hushai the Archite  the king’s companion.
After Ahithophel  Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, then Abiathar. And the general of the king’s army  Joab.
